column1: Smoque BBQ////The sides were as impressive as the meat
column2: and they made our barbecue session into a complete feast.  I loved the mac and cheese.  It was very cheesy with a touch of creaminess and a nice crispy topping of bread crumbs.  The beans were among some of the best I've had
column3: full of flavor with a far cooked but toothsome texture.  The brisket chili was likewise fantastic
column4: deeply comforting with nice shreds of meat.  The cole slaw was the only light side on the table
column5: and it was refreshingly easy on the mayo
column6: with crisp clean flavors to cut through the smoke and fat of our meal.  The cornbread was the one side I stopped eating after a bite.  Not bad
column8: a little hard and a little short on butter.
